name: test_report_view
description:
Test: Verify reporting values update correctly after vaccination and edit.
Steps:
1. Record a flu vaccination for a child and verify initial reporting values.
2. Refresh reports and check that the cohort and vaccination percentages update.
3. Edit the child's vaccination record to mark the outcome as refused.
4. Refresh reports and verify that the reporting values reflect the refusal.
Verification:
- After vaccination, report shows 1 more vaccinated and 0 more not vaccinated.
- After marking as refused, report shows 0 more vaccinated and
  1 more not vaccinated.
descriptionHtml:
Test: Verify reporting values update correctly after vaccination and edit.
Steps:

  1. Record a flu vaccination for a child and verify initial reporting values.
  2. Refresh reports and check that the cohort and vaccination percentages update.
  3. Edit the child's vaccination record to mark the outcome as refused.
  4. Refresh reports and verify that the reporting values reflect the refusal.
    Verification:
  • After vaccination, report shows 1 more vaccinated and 0 more not vaccinated.
  • After marking as refused, report shows 0 more vaccinated and
    1 more not vaccinated.
statusMessage:
AssertionError: Locator expected to contain text '2children' Actual value: 1children Call log: - Expect "to_contain_text" with timeout 5000ms - waiting for get_by_role("heading", name="Cohort", exact=True).locator("xpath=following-sibling::*[1]") 9 × locator resolved to

…

- unexpected value "1children"
statusTrace:
record_injected_flu = (Child(first_name='Christopher', last_name='TURNER', nhs_number='9047574664', address=('Studio 93I', 'Thomas street', ...rray@example.org'))), datetime.datetime(2025, 10, 31, 9, 8, 26, 969636, tzinfo=zoneinfo.ZoneInfo(key='Europe/London'))) schools = {'HPV': [School(name='Kettering Buccleuch Academy', urn='135966', site=None), School(name='Lancaster School', urn='144...School', urn='118085', site=None), School(name='Nord Anglia International School Abu Dhabi', urn='151549', site=None)]} reports_vaccinations_page = dashboard_page = children_page = vaccination_record_page = edit_vaccination_record_page = def test_report_view( record_injected_flu, schools, reports_vaccinations_page, dashboard_page, children_page, vaccination_record_page, edit_vaccination_record_page, ): """ Test: Verify reporting values update correctly after vaccination and edit. Steps: 1. Record a flu vaccination for a child and verify initial reporting values. 2. Refresh reports and check that the cohort and vaccination percentages update. 3. Edit the child's vaccination record to mark the outcome as refused. 4. Refresh reports and verify that the reporting values reflect the refusal. Verification: - After vaccination, report shows 1 more vaccinated and 0 more not vaccinated. - After marking as refused, report shows 0 more vaccinated and 1 more not vaccinated. """ child, _ = record_injected_flu school = schools[Programme.FLU][0] reports_vaccinations_page.navigate() reports_vaccinations_page.check_filter_for_programme(Programme.FLU) vaccinated_count = reports_vaccinations_page.get_children_count("Vaccinated") unvaccinated_count = reports_vaccinations_page.get_children_count("Not vaccinated") ( expected_cohort_count, expected_unvaccinated_percentage, expected_vaccinated_percentage, ) = reports_vaccinations_page.get_expected_cohort_and_percentage_strings( unvaccinated_count, vaccinated_count ) reports_vaccinations_page.check_cohort_has_n_children(expected_cohort_count) reports_vaccinations_page.check_category_percentage( "Not vaccinated", expected_unvaccinated_percentage ) reports_vaccinations_page.check_category_percentage( "Vaccinated", expected_vaccinated_percentage ) reports_vaccinations_page.navigate_and_refresh_reports() reports_vaccinations_page.check_filter_for_programme(Programme.FLU) ( expected_cohort_count, expected_unvaccinated_percentage, expected_vaccinated_percentage, ) = reports_vaccinations_page.get_expected_cohort_and_percentage_strings( unvaccinated_count, vaccinated_count + 1 ) > reports_vaccinations_page.check_cohort_has_n_children(expected_cohort_count) tests/test_reporting_values.py:141: _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ mavis/test/annotations.py:35: in wrapper return_value = func(self, *args, **kwargs) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ self = expected_value = '2' @step("Check cohort has {1} children") def check_cohort_has_n_children(self, expected_value: int) -> None: cohort_heading = self.page.get_by_role("heading", name="Cohort", exact=True) cohort_value = cohort_heading.locator("xpath=following-sibling::*[1]") > expect(cohort_value).to_contain_text(f"{expected_value}children") E AssertionError: Locator expected to contain text '2children' E Actual value: 1children E Call log: E - Expect "to_contain_text" with timeout 5000ms E - waiting for get_by_role("heading", name="Cohort", exact=True).locator("xpath=following-sibling::*[1]") E 9 × locator resolved to

…

E - unexpected value "1children" mavis/test/pages/reports.py:54: AssertionError

Steps:

4. Refresh reports and verify that the reporting values reflect the refusal.
Verification:
